description:
We are using kilo nova with commit id b8c4f1bce356838dd3dac3b59734cf47f72373e5.
We setup 3 cells and fail to boot vm if we pass key-name and compute side complain the key-name was not found.
The key was stored in az nova db not in cell nova db. When compute query keypair information, it query cell db via cell message queue and cell return no keypair found error
title: In kilo nova, cell mode, nova boot fail with key

comments.content:
We are using kilo nova with commit id b8c4f1bce356838dd3dac3b59734cf47f72373e5.
We setup 3 cells and fail to boot vm if we pass key-name and compute side complain the key-name was not found.
The key was stored in az nova db not in cell nova db. When compute query keypair information, it query cell db via cell message queue and cell return no keypair found error
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~wangfengatustc

comments.content: This bug lacks the necessary information to effectively reproduce and fix it, therefore it has been closed. Feel free to reopen the bug by providing the requested information and set the bug status back to ''New''.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mzoeller

comments.content:
This is a known limitation of Cells v1. Many APIs don't work correctly in cells v1 because the parent databases isn't synced with cell databases, except for the instances table. So keypairs are only in the parent database and can't be queried from cells. Here is a related bug for flavors [1].

To work around, you would have to manually sync keypairs to your cell databases.

This problem won't be addressed in Cells v1 and will be handled correctly in Cells v2.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1211011
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~melwitt
